poem:
**Reopening the Rafah Crossing**

Beyond the double arch,  
a breath held since May is released,  
the air rich with glimpses  
of a passage newfound—  
a camera catches the hope of light  
as men and women file through,  
cradled by borders that murmur  
ceasefire, ceasefire,  
the murmurs of a world  
still stitched by barbed lines.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
